required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Preference for a Prefilled Syringe or Smartject™ Device for Delivering Golimumab in Participants Suffering From Moderate-to-severe Ulcerative Colitis (MK-8259-027)
clinical_study.official_title: Preference for a Prefilled Syringe or Smartject™ Device for Delivering SIMPONI (Golimumab) in Patients Suffering From Moderate to Severe Ulcerative Colitis

brief_summary.textblock: This study is designed to determine whether ulcerative colitis participants prefer delivery of golimumab via a prefilled syringe or the Smartject™ device.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Prefer Prefilled Syringe, Smartject™ Device, or Are Undecided (Day of Injections)
primary_outcome.description: Golimumab 50 mg supplied in a prefilled syringe administered 2 times (once by the treating physician and then by the participant under the supervision of the treating physician). Participant is then administered Golimumab 50 mg supplied in the Smartject 2 times, first by the physician and then by the participant. Following the completion of the last injection, the participants completed a questionnaire in which they indicated if they preferred the syringe, the Smartject or were undecided as to which they preferred.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Prefer Prefilled Syringe, Smartject™ Device, or Are Undecided (2 Weeks Post Injections)
primary_outcome.description: Golimumab 50 mg supplied in a prefilled syringe administered 2 times (once by the treating physician and then by the participant under the supervision of the treating physician). Participant than is administered Golimumab 50 mg supplied in the Smartject 2 times, first by the physician and then by the participant. Participants completed a questionnaire 2 weeks after the injections in which they indicated if they preferred the syringe, the Smartject or were undecided as to which they preferred.

arm_group.description: Golimumab 50 mg supplied in a prefilled syringe administered 2 times (once by the treating physician and then by the participant under the supervision of the treating physician). Participant is then administered Golimumab 50 mg supplied in the Smartject 2 times, first by the physician and then by the participant. Participants receive a total of 200 mg of golimumbab).

Golimumab 50 mg supplied in a Smartject administered 2 times (once by the treating physician and then by the participant under the supervision of the treating physician). Participant is then administered Golimumab 50 mg supplied a prefilled syringe 2 times, first by the physician and then by the participant. Participants receive a total of 200 mg of golimumbab.

intervention.description: Golimumab 50 mg solution for subcutaneous injection using prefilled syringe
Golimumab 50 mg solution for subcutaneous injection using Smartject Device.

group.title: Prefilled Syringe→Smartject™ Device
group.description: Golimumab 50 mg supplied in a prefilled syringe administered 2 times (once by the treating physician and then by the participant under the supervision of the treating physician). Participant than is administered Golimumab 50 mg supplied in the Smartject 2 times, first by the physician and then by the participant. Participants receive a total of 200 mg of golimumbab.

group.title: Smartject™ Device→ Prefilled Syringe
group.description: Golimumab 50 mg supplied in a Smartject administered 2 times (once by the treating physician and then by the participant under the supervision of the treating physician). Participant than is administered Golimumab 50 mg supplied a prefilled syringe 2 times, first by the physician and then by the participant. Participants receive a total of 200 mg of golimumbab.

baseline.population: 1 enrolled participant withdrew prior to treatment.

group.title: All Treated Participants
group.description: All participants who received at least 1 injection from either prefilled syringe or Smartject

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Who Prefer Prefilled Syringe, Smartject™ Device, or Are Undecided (Day of Injections)
outcome.description: Golimumab 50 mg supplied in a prefilled syringe administered 2 times (once by the treating physician and then by the participant under the supervision of the treating physician). Participant is then administered Golimumab 50 mg supplied in the Smartject 2 times, first by the physician and then by the participant. Following the completion of the last injection, the participants completed a questionnaire in which they indicated if they preferred the syringe, the Smartject or were undecided as to which they preferred.
outcome.population: All enrolled participants who met all inclusion and none of the exclusion criteria, received all four injections of golimumab according to the protocol, and completed the device preference questionnaire

group.title: Per Protocl Set (PPS)
group.description: All enrolled participants who met all inclusion and none of the exclusion criteria, received all four injections of golimumab according to the protocol, and completed the device preference questionnaire.

reported_events.desc: The study was crossover using 2 types of injection methods per participant, without a wash-out period between injection types. It was not possible to relate an adverse event (AE) to a specific injection method. Hence, per protocol, AEs were summarized for all participants who received at least 1 dose of golimumab, regardless of injection type.

group.title: All Treated Participants
group.description: All participants who received at least 1 injection from either prefilled syringe or Smartject

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The investigator agrees not to publish or publicly present any interim results of the trial without the prior written consent of the sponsor. The investigator further agrees to provide to the sponsor 45 days prior to submission for publication or presentation, review copies of abstracts or manuscripts for publication that report any results of the trial.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Senior Vice President, Global Clinical Development
